sub_title: Senior User Experience Designer for Philips Hue at Signify

awards.title: Good Design Award - Philips Avent DECT Baby Monitor 2017-2018
awards.description:
This Digital Baby Monitor focuses on parents’ core requirements with crystal clear sound, a reliable connection and 100% channel privacy. Its clean design, unique in the baby monitor space, has minimal gadgetry to detract from the main function of being able to hear the baby well. Accessibly priced, it is empathic to the needs of parent and baby – a warm and friendly yet highly domestic look and feel, soft and tactile touch, simple and easy to use, and easy to clean. The parent unit can stand or be clipped onto pants. The baby unit also features a subtle night light, can play lullabies, and produce ceiling light-shows.

https://www.good-designawards.com/award-details.html?award=35345

I was responsible for usability of the UI and the product itself, working closely with a product designer, developers and marketeers throughout the development of the product.

awards.title: Good Design Award - Philips Avent Smart baby bottle
awards.description:
This baby bottle is a combination of a 125 ml bottle and an intelligent sleeve. The sleeve is activated via simple one-button interaction and records quantity, time, duration and interruptions of a bottle-feed. The data are transmitted to the smart baby bottle app and automatically archived. The sleeve is light, pleasant to hold thanks to soft-touch materials and also easy to remove.

https://www.good-designawards.com/award-details.html?award=35349

I was responsible for the visual design and UI of the smart baby bottle app and the interaction between app and smart baby bottle. Furthermore, I was one of they key players in bringing the smart baby bottle to the market in the Netherlands, including responsibility for marketing and activation.

awards.title: Muse Award - Philips Avent smart baby bottle
awards.description:
Smart baby bottle consists of a 4 oz bottle, inserted into a sleeve. It tracks the volume, time, and duration of a feed and automatically uploads the data to the Baby+ App, removing the need to write this information down manually. Lightweight with a soft touch material, it is very comfortable to hold and allows easy removal for sterilizing and switching bottles. A minimally invasive design, it limits feedback and light guides during feeding to prevent the baby from getting distracted. A simple one-button interaction enables tracking with the press of a button.

https://design.museaward.com/winner-info.php?id=1058

I was responsible for the visual design and UI of the smart baby bottle app and the interaction between app and smart baby bottle. Furthermore, I was one of they key players in bringing the smart baby bottle to the market in the Netherlands, including responsibility for marketing and activation.

awards.title: Red Dot award - Smart baby bottle
awards.description:
This baby bottle is a combination of a 125 ml bottle and an intelligent sleeve. The sleeve is activated via simple one-button interaction and records quantity, time, duration and interruptions of a bottle-feed. The data are transmitted to the smart baby bottle app and automatically archived. The sleeve is light, pleasant to hold thanks to soft-touch materials and also easy to remove. 

Statement by the Jury
This clever additional feature for the baby bottle simplifies documentation of the drinking behaviour and thus remains visually discreet in the background.

https://www.red-dot.org/project/philips-avent-smart-baby-bottle-38446

I was responsible for the visual design and UI of the smart baby bottle app and the interaction between app and smart baby bottle. Furthermore, I was one of they key players in bringing the smart baby bottle to the market in the Netherlands, including responsibility for marketing and activation.

awards.title: CES 2017 Innovation Award HONOREE - Philips Avent uGrow digital parenting platform
awards.description:
Designed to help new parents understand and support their baby’s healthy development, the uGrow app connects wirelessly to the Philips Avent smart baby monitor and smart ear thermometer as well as collating manually inputted data such as feeding and sleeping patterns. Recognizing that every baby is unique, the uGrow ecosystem creates a highly personalized supportive environment around babies and their parents, with the interactive app providing featured articles based on insight from a panel of breastfeeding, sleep and developmental psychology experts. Planned integration of new Philips’ devices into uGrow include Philips’ connected Smart Baby Bottle Sleeve, which monitors milk temperature and consumed volume, a connected air purifier to monitor air quality and the Hue lighting system to create a relaxing soothing environment. Inputting data and tracking information into uGrow will soon be easier with the addition of Amazon Echo voice activation. 

I was responsible for representing the consumer in the design and development process. Identifying user needs, translating user needs to user requirements, and developing them into designs and the final app. Working closely with marketing, development and design to bring together all disciplines to launch an app which satisfies and delights customers.

awards.title: IF design award - Philips Avent uGrow baby development platform
awards.description:
Discipline: communication

Philips Avent uGrow: uGrow is the innovative parenting app for the millennial who turns to their smartphone first for advice. Medically certified, the app securely collects data through uGrow connected devices (e.g. the Smart baby monitor and thermometer). By analyzing feeding and sleeping patterns, parents can track possible problems and share these with their pediatrician. As well as reassuring new parents by visualizing complex data, memorable moments can be captured through photos and "stickers" and then saved to a simple timeline that will grow with baby to the delight of today's and tomorrow's connected parents.

https://ifworlddesignguide.com/entry/201959-philips-avent-ugrow

I was responsible for representing the consumer in the design and development process. Identifying user needs, translating user needs to user requirements, and developing them into designs and the final app. Working closely with marketing, development and design to bring together all disciplines to launch an app which satisfies and delights customers.

projects.title: MVO Jaarverslag 2014 - Baetsen-Groep
projects.description:
Voor de verlenging van de MVO niveau 3 certificering is een MVO jaarverslag over 2014 samengesteld, dat inzicht verschaft in de wijze waarop Baetsen vorm geeft aan de maatschappelijke verantwoordelijkheid die het bedrijf heeft. 

Mijn rol binnen het MVO jaarverslag was het verzorgen van het grafisch ontwerp. Dit omvat de grafische vormgeving, ontwerpen van grafieken, en deel van de fotografie. Het eindresultaat kan in de link bekeken worden.
http://www.baetsen.com/uploads/Documentatie/mvo_jaarverslag_2014_baetsen_groep.pdf

contributors.headline: Senior User Experience Designer for Philips Hue at Signify

projects.title: Dutch Design Week 2014 - Trail - Interactie in het Ziekenhuis
projects.description:
Trail 
Interactie in het ziekenhuis – De interactieve applicatie Trail nodigt kinderen in het ziekenhuis uit op avontuur te gaan door een serie mysteries op te lossen en de sporen van verborgen dieren te zoeken. Het spel speelt zich af op een tablet of smartphone, maar maakt gebruik van de echte omgeving via de camera van deze apparaten. Door het toepassen van een techniek genaamd Augmented Reality worden de grenzen tussen digitaal en fysiek vervaagd. Het spel leidt kinderen af en stimuleert hen hun kamer te verlaten en te spelen met andere kinderen. 

Trail 
Interaction in the hospital – The interactive application called Trail stimulates children in the hospital to embark on an adventurous quest by solving a series of mysteries and searching for the tracks of concealed animals. The game is played on a tablet or smartphone, however using the physical environment of the hospital through the camera of these devices. By applying a technique called Augmented Reality the boundaries between the digital and the physical world are blurred. The game takes the children’s mind off things and encourages them to leave their room and play with other children.

projects.title: Energy Belt, NANO Supermarket
projects.description:
The NANO Supermarket is an exhibition in which speculative nanotech products are being shown that possibly can be realised in the next 10 years. The exhibition strives to spreading the word about nanotechnology, and start a discussion about the possible future we're heading into. For the new call of products my Energy Belt was selected, to be futured in the new exhibition starting at the Dutch Design Week 2012. The Energy Belt is a belt which uses the natural processes within our bodies to burn excess body fat and convert it into electrical energy. The belt gives a new perspective on fat, where it isn't seen as a liability but as a possible usefull source in de future?
Press the above link for a preview of the Energy Belt at Llowlab, Lowlands Festival

contributors.headline: Senior User Experience Designer for Philips Hue at Signify

projects.title: Waves at GLOW NEXT
projects.description:
WAVES
 
See your own soundwaves
 

Light and sound are two types of waves. Like radio and the waves that our cell phones make to communicate with each other. We are continuously surrounded by waves, but we never see them.

Until now! Because here, at the cradle of radio and television, sound waves are being visualized. Whistle, clap, talk, sing or scream and see the waves you produce yourself. Experience how waves travel through space and bounce off the walls. Discover how different tones also produce different waves.

WAVES is a world premiere. The project is based on the sound imaging technology of Sorama, which is commercially available in the brand new 1024 microphone Sorama Cam. WAVES is a joint effort of a team of 9 students of OPENLIGHT: the creative lab of the Intelligent Lighting Institute of the TU Eindhoven, and a team of 15 sound experts and software developers of Sorama, a spin-off of the TU/e that is located at Strijp-S. The result is a unprecedented interactive lighting visualization.

This 6-week project I performed as part of the student team from OPENLIGHT at the TU/e. We were responsible for the conceptual development of this installation, as well as the design of the visual appearance, experience and the first version of the visualisation code used. 

The installation was originally developed for the light spectacle 'GLOW-Next' in Eindhoven, but has since then been at multiple events among which the Dutch Design Week 2014 as part of the exhibition 'Mind the Step'.

projects.title: Bachelor Graduation Project - Philips Research
projects.description:
NDA Project - Bachelor Graduation at Human Interaction & Experiences group at Philips Research

This graduation project was set-up as a continuation of the internship done at Philips Research from september 2012 until januari 2013. 
It focused on the further development of a concept revolving around patient guidance during mammography. Important elements were patient experience, workflow integration and user (technician) support. 

Skills applied during this internship involved qualitative user-research (contextual inquiry), concept development, interaction design, (rapid) prototyping, Intellectual Property generation and writing of invention disclosures and user-centered design explorations.

projects.title: Bachelor Internship Philips Research - Human Interaction & Experiences Group
projects.description:
NDA Project - 4 month Internship at Human Interaction & Experiences group at Philips Research

During this 4 month Internship I worked as part of an IP-Generation Project focused on workflow improvement at the radiology department of the hospital. I was responsible for concept development focused on exploring the role of the patient in the hospital workflow. 

Skills applied during this internship involved qualitative user-research (contextual inquiry), concept ideation, Intellectual Property generation and writing of invention disclosures and user-centered design explorations.

company.name: Next Nature Network / The NANO supermarket

profile_positions.description:
The NANO supermarket shows speculative nano products which may hit the shelves within now and ten years. We try to bring nano technology to the public and start a debate about the future. 
In the NANO supermarket I work as a host, I welcome the visitors and guide them through the exhibition, answering questions and trying to provoke a discussion and activate their own thinking. I try to make them aware of the fast changes in technology and the impact it might have on their everyday lives. My goal is to try and get them to formulate their own opinion on these matters in an active engagement, questioning and discussing the products exhibited in the NANO supermarket.
Next to being a host, I've also been given the opportunity to design a product for the NANO supermarket, which is now featured in the new line of products. More on this project can be found under "projects" on this LinkedIn Page.
